result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber Joy Briggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amber Joy Briggs is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amber Joy Briggs was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Amber Joy Briggs was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
AND ARRAIGNMENT 9:17 AM Court calls cases 21CF22 and 22CF188. Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amber Joy Briggs in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Rosenthal in court for Amber Joy Briggs. State indicates an agreement has been reached. In 22CF188, defendant will plead to either count 1 or 2 and count 4. On count 1 or 2, state asks for 220 days jail, imposed and stayed for 2 years of probation. Conditions of 55 days jail with 55 days credit (time served), DOC programming, $50 fine plus costs. Count 4, 90 days jail concurrent to count 1. In 21 CF22, the parties stipulate to deferred agreement being revoked. State asks for sentence of 101 day jail with 76 days credit (time served), $100 fine plus costs. 
Court terminates DJOC in 21CF22. Judgment of conviction is entered. Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1 and 4 in 22CF188. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the pleas and finds the defendant's pleas have been knowingly and voluntarily made. Defendant is found guilty and judgement of conviction is entered. Any other charges are dismissed. State makes statement and reviews pending criminal charges in other county, asks court to adopt joint recommendation. 
Court orders in 22CF188, 220 days jail, imposed and stayed for 2 years of probation. Conditions of 55 days jail with 55 days credit (time served), DOC programming, $50 fine plus costs. Count 4, 90 days jail imposed and stayed for 2 years of probation, concurrent to count 1. Conditions of 55 days jail with 55 days credit (time served), DOC programming, concurrent to count 1. Both jail sentences are consecutive to any other sentence. Court orders in 21CF22, 101 day jail with 76 days credit (time served), $100 fine plus costs.

records.addlTxt:
3:36 PM Defendant Amber Joy Briggs appeared by video.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
defendant indicates pd's offices said she does qualify. requests to go forward on wed.
atty hoffman states will have atty or he will represent.
PH kept on

No contact with Victim 1 or their address. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Defendant must notify Clerk of Courts of current/updated address within 24 hours of release from custody.

3:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amber Joy Briggs appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker appeared by video for Amber Joy Briggs. Court calls case. Defendant indicates that she does not have an address, provides mailing address. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. States asks for $1,500 cash bail. No contact with Victim 1 or address listed in the ID Key. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State indicates there are no prior criminal convictions but has an open DJOC in Douglas county with 2 FTAs. Also has open warrant in Lincoln county and 2 FTAs in that case on a $500 signature bond. Has also had previous warrants for FTAs in this county. Court asks the State for clarification on Count 5 of this matter. Attorney Craker indicates the defendant is a local resident and the charges are nonviolent felony charges. Indicates she does not have a criminal history.
Court notes concerns over lack of address and 4 recent FTAs, a warrant pending, and a violation of the DJOC in this county. Court orders $1500. No contact with Victim 1 or their address. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Defendant must notify Clerk of Courts of current/updated address within 24 hours of release from custody.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Amended signature bond signed from case # 2021CF22
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
